availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Lapsley McGoodwin (Caldwell County, Kentucky, clerk and adjt's clerk, master serg. 3rd KY mtd Inf (CSA))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of P. Bell McGoodwin and Grace W. McGoodwin. Resident and student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned six enslaved individuals in Caldwell County in 1850. Deputy county clerk in Caldwell County in 1860. Household owned ten enslaved individuals in Caldwell County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (CSA) as a private, master sergeant, and adjutant's clerk from August 17, 1861, to May 1865.

Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0093.
